value: <l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">so that we forget something in ourselves when we</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">read it. <del>We</del> It gives us another being.</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">Only, as the unknown man who, it is said once</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">[held?] houses at the door, becomes more &</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0"><del>more dominant, as [wine?] we fallen &</del></l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0"><del>stumble: we have to</del></l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">Anonymity <del>h</del> gave us the ballads; it gave us the songs;</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">it <del>gave us</del> is a great preservative. To</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">know nothing except what is essential: to waste no</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">time prying & peeping: <del>but to</del> to be</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">know nothing – who wrote <quote source="#" rend="inline">Lud Sing Cuccu</quote></l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">who wrote <quote source="#" rend="inline">[Hilu Fan?]</quote> – who wrote the</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">[sonnets?] of [loys?], [mirthful], <del>who</del> but wrote to</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">[ful?] spring, <del>dea</del> love, death    <del>But</del>    That</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">And the stage with its bodies, its actors, taking</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">part for some time preserved this anonymous voice <del>only</del> until</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">when the <del>[senses?]</del> of the age, its hoard of</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">[unfilled?] patterns, the [illeg.] in the [armtials?]</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">of maids of [him?] & [curtain?]; pressed so hard on the</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">dramatist that he invented a speech</l>

<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">that 
            <choice>
              <sic>cd.</sic>
              <corr>could</corr>
            </choice> give voice to everything.</l>

<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">Then, with 
            <rs type="person" ref="../resources/annotations.xml#psn-wsha" key="Shakespeare, William"><choice>
              <sic>Sh<hi rend="superscript">re</hi></sic>
              <corr>Shakespeare</corr>
            </choice></rs>, anonymity was destroyed..</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">Everything is known that can be known until</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">the stage becomes too small to act the</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">drama; & <del>there is</del> the book takes the place of the</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0"><del>stage</del> play.</l>

<add xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0" place="margin">
            <l>his weight of</l>
            <l>pause, <del>the</del></l>
            <l><del>dumb like of the</del></l>
            <l><del>king</del> held</l>
          </add>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0"><rs type="person" ref="../resources/annotations.xml#psn-anon">Anon</rs>, after all, has great privileges. He <del>can</del> is irrepressible.</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">He is not responsible. He is not self conscious. He is</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">free from infection. He can adventure & experiment.</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">He can borrow. He can <del>jest</del> speak <add place="above">on & on</add>. He can</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">say what everyone feels: the common experiences</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">are his. No one asks that he shall be</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">idiosyncratic: that he shall stamp his</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">[dull?] [illeg.] on the old feelings: He shapes</l>
